questions.answer_description: Neighboring APs offering the same connection type and parameters use the same name, or service set identifier (SSID, which is a simple ASCII string providing a name to the connection). Neighboring APs offering the same connection use the same SSID, but each AP identifies itself by associating its radio MAC address to the SSID string. This associated MAC address is called the basic service set identifier (BSSID), and it enables stations to know which AP offers which SSID.
questions.question_text:
An AP has been configured for personal wireless access to the Internet using appropriate security and cloaking.
Which two items should be configured on the wireless client? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: It refers to Personal or Enterprise mode of WPA/WPA2.
Maybe I'm wrong, but personal wireless access means for me 802.1X/EAP, because PSK is not personal: Every client uses the same PSK.

questions.answer_description: The apple iPhone 4 and iPAD2 supports only 2.4 Ghz (no 5 Ghz) wireless networks. Support for 5Ghz networks was introduced with the Apple iPhone5 and the iPAD 3.
questions.question_text: The introduction of consumer phones and tablets into enterprise WLANs can have an impact on 802.11a/b/ g/n deployments. The Apple iPhone 4 and iPad 2 are very common examples. Which statement best describes the abilities of these devices?

choices.C: The Apple iPhone 4 uses 2.4 GHz and the iPad 2 uses 2.4 GHz or 5 GHz. The Apple iPhone 4 only uses one spatial stream and the iPad 2 uses two spatial streams.
choices.A: The Apple iPhone 4 and the iPad 2 use 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz. The Apple iPhone 4 uses only one spatial stream and the iPad 2 uses two spatial streams.
choices.D: The Apple iPhone 4 uses 2.4 GHz and the iPad 2 uses 2.4 GHz or 5 GHz. The Apple iPhone 4 and the iPad 2 use only one spatial stream.
choices.B: The Apple iPhone 4 uses only 2.4 GHz and the iPad 2 only uses 5 GHz. The Apple iPhone 4 uses only one spatial stream and the iPad 2 uses two spatial streams.

discussion.content:
https://wifitodd.com/2018/04/05/wifi-ios-and-osx-specifications-and-cisco-best-practice-references/

D is correct but the explanation is wrong / does not match.
The Ipad 2 supports 2.4ghz or 5ghz N, with one spatial stream.
The Iphone 4 supports only 2.4ghz with one spatial stream.

questions.question_text: Which IEEE 802.11n client feature can combine the signal from multiple antennas and radio chains to improve SNR?

discussion.content:
https://learningnetwork.cisco.com/docs/DOC-31396
Maximal-Ratio Combining
Basically this is where we use our extra antennas in a MIMO-device to try and improve the SNR-of a signal. It can receive multiple copies of the same signal and then combine them into one single signal that has a better SNR then the two individually received signals. In a nutshell though, this requires that a transmitter sends the original signal out from two or more transmitters, and that the receiver also receives multiple copies of the same signal and then tries to improve the received signal into a higher quality signal.

questions.question_text: When a wireless client is authenticated in a controller-based wireless network, which three pieces of source identification information can be used by the controller for an Access-Request message that is sent to an external RADIUS server? (Choose three.)
questions.answer_description:
From the Call Station ID Type drop-down list, choose IP Address, System MAC Address, or AP MAC Address to specify whether the IP address, system MAC address, or AP MAC address of the originator will be sent to the RADIUS server in the Access-Request message. http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/7-0/configuration/guide/c70/c70sol.html#wp1389032
(Step 3)

discussion.content:
No, no client information can be configured.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/8-8/config-guide/b_cg88/aaa_administration.html
I think it should be BDF. Anyone else ?

questions.question_text: An engineer needs an AP with at least two spatial streams, four receivers, and three transmitters. Which device meets these requirements?
